components.name: eucanetd
components.description: Used to track component level items associated with Edge.

fields.summary: VPC - nat rules not applied on backend router for EIP w/o disassociation of the previous EIP

comments.body: Waiting for other VPC fixes to land before retesting this.
Returning to [~mclark] for verification now that some new VPC code has landed. Thanks!

[~mclark], I've run through these steps against master 12 times this morning, and am not seeing the behavior in current VPCMIDO against master - I think we're going to need to move this back to you in order to see if there is a case that we can capture.  This is the script I've been running that emulates the steps you described, above and I have not yet seen it fail:

#!/bin/bash
ASSC=`euca-associate-address -a eipalloc-4a1c6a70 -i i-d9dbd2d6 | awk '{print $4}'`
sleep 5
ping -c 3 -w 10 10.116.150.32

euca-disassociate-address -a $ASSC
sleep 5
IP=`euca-describe-instances i-d9dbd2d6 | grep INST | awk '{print $13}'`
ping -c 3 -w 10 $IP

euca-associate-address -a eipalloc-fa8e723b -i i-d9dbd2d6
sleep 5
ping -c 3 -w 10 10.116.150.165

ASSC=`euca-associate-address -a eipalloc-4a1c6a70 -i i-d9dbd2d6 | awk '{print $4}'`
sleep 5
ping -c 3 -w 10 10.116.150.32

euca-disassociate-address -a $ASSC
sleep 5
IP=`euca-describe-instances i-d9dbd2d6 | grep INST | awk '{print $13}'`
ping -c 3 -w 10 $IP

I ran through a similar set of tests with EIPs as before and did not see this issue. Assuming this was addressed by one of the recent fixes. 
Thanks,
-M
